[{"id":"f13dc8e0-8432-4f9a-9de7-bd1bd4fd364c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: _get_target_ns","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4ab04bbf-2262-485d-a6bd-4809debc15a3","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"_get_target_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is a specialized coordinate-calculation utility. Its primary role is to determine the fully qualified namespace of a variable that is being targeted (usually on the left-hand side of an assignment). It translates AST nodes like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.user","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data['key']","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" into their complete internal identifiers based on the current context.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"26d0e58c-8520-4629-a8b1-4fd2de5cf97a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"To record an assignment, the analyzer needs to know exactly which "slot" in its database to update. Simply knowing a variable is named ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" isn't enough because there might be dozens of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" variables in a project. This function calculates the absolute "path" (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main_module.MyClass.my_method.x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), allowing the analyzer to maintain perfect separation between different scopes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"12078b2b-8c5b-40c6-a251-4870fcc8e28b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The function uses recursion to resolve the namespace based on the type of AST node:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bfcfbe06-a79f-44c1-97e0-0c123d34e8ad","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simple Names (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"ast.Name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" This is the base case. It takes the variable ID (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"user","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and joins it with the currently active namespace (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.current_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"772302ef-bda9-4f2a-be93-38f5dcd33fdf","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Result:","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"ast.Attribute","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" This handles dotted access like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"obj.attr","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"8d68d0d2-fe56-45fb-8833-90df9d9c2dd4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It recursively calls itself on the base object (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"obj","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to find its namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dbb8f118-9d15-453a-bb1b-b32f1f4d948d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It then appends the attribute name to those base ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"my_list[0]","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"79bbfe44-05e1-4d7a-b6d9-8cb49ffcb5a6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"If the analyzer is inside a method ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"update_status","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and encounters:
","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.status = "Active"","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"33f4c555-d09b-484c-a0b9-1721d548c1a9","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"_get_target_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is called for the target ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self.status","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fd8eece6-96f5-4b3d-a7d8-bb85088de737","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It sees an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Attribute","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" node. It first tries to resolve ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6eb7f145-9df9-4107-a104-434210f264fc","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The recursive call for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.UserClass.self","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"34ffc0f3-8f07-4e9a-b001-a247181483fc","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It then joins the attribute ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"status","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to that result.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d3640ad4-eb2c-44b6-9453-eca5cff353ba","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The final result is ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.UserClass.self.status","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ensuring the assignment is recorded against the class instance variable.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"22dbdff3-c175-4d20-b40b-3c1603a5d15f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
